parts.text:
Slurm

```json
{
  "application": "Slurm",
  "details": {
    "nodes": 1,
    "cpus_per_task": 16,
    "gres": "gpu:volta:1",
    "modules": [
      "anaconda",
      "cuda"
    ],
    "python_script": "src/run_TCT.py",
    "dataset": "dermamnist",
    "architecture": "small_resnet14",
    "data_dir": "../data",
    "save_dir": "experiments"
  },
  "variants": [
    {
      "name": "TCT",
      "rounds_stage1": 100,
      "rounds_stage2": 100,
      "local_epochs_stage1": 5,
      "local_lr_stage1": 0.01,
      "local_steps_stage2": 500,
      "local_lr_stage2": 0.0001,
      "momentum": 0.9,
      "use_data_augmentation": true,
      "override": true
    },
    {
      "name": "FedAvg",
      "rounds_stage1": 200,
      "rounds_stage2": 0,
      "local_epochs_stage1": 5,
      "local_lr_stage1": 0.01,
      "momentum": 0.9,
      "use_data_augmentation": true
    },
    {
      "name": "Centrally hosted",
      "rounds_stage1": 200,
      "rounds_stage2": 0,
      "local_epochs_stage1": 1,
      "local_lr_stage1": 0.01,
      "momentum": 0.9,
      "use_data_augmentation": true,
      "central": true
    },
    {
      "name": "TCT (IID)",
      "rounds_stage1": 100,
      "rounds_stage2": 100,
      "local_epochs_stage1": 5,
      "local_lr_stage1": 0.01,
      "local_steps_stage2": 500,
      "local_lr_stage2": 0.0001,
      "momentum": 0.9,
      "use_data_augmentation": true,
      "use_iid_partition": true
    },
    {
      "name": "FedAvg (IID)",
      "rounds_stage1": 200,
      "rounds_stage2": 0,
      "local_epochs_stage1": 5,
      "local_lr_stage1": 0.01,
      "momentum": 0.9,
      "use_data_augmentation": true,
      "use_iid_partition": true
    }
  ]
}
```

The script uses Slurm as a job scheduler. This is a common approach for running jobs on high-performance computing clusters.

The script also utilizes a GPU (volta) and requires the `anaconda` and `cuda` modules to be loaded. It appears to be running a machine learning experiment using the `run_TCT.py` script, which implements the TCT and FedAvg federated learning algorithms.

The experiment is run on the `dermamnist` dataset using a `small_resnet14` architecture. The script specifies several parameters for each algorithm variation, including the number of training rounds, local epochs, learning rates, and whether to use data augmentation or an independent and identically distributed (IID) data partition.

The output of each variant is saved to the `experiments` directory.
